page.title: 17BISON CONCRETE, LICHFIELD
page.content: A regional division of Concrete Ltd., a company formed by two Royal Engineer Officers who were jointly responsible for the invention and production of precast concrete "pill boxes" during World War 1. The Lichfield factory was opened in 1945 and occupies an area of approximately nine acres. It presently employs around 180 men and women. These include production workers and office staff, estimators, draughtsmen and sales staff. The works itself has numerous trades such as carpenters, fitters, electricians and concrete makers. The company produces specialist precast concrete units such as panels and staircases etc., but the main product is prestressed concrete floor and roofing slabs which are now manufactured by slideformer type machinery.
